Stern scourge of Lux'ry, and imperious Pride,</br>Child of Intemperance blasting human bliss!</br>How chills the vigorous mind</br>By thy fell pow'r controll'd!
Thee, writhing pain, thee, wasting sickness wait,</br>Thee, all the agonizing train of death;—</br>Thrown on thy freezing bed</br>Thou feel'st keen-biting gales:
Loud ruffian tempests shake thy tottering shed</br>Whilst thou, unshelter'd in the savage night,</br>Reprov'st the tardy hours</br>That linger thro' the gloom.
Yet not the dewy Day-light sooths thy soul,</br>Nor Eve, who draws her weeping shadows round,</br>Nor sweet, indulgent Spring,</br>With all her fragrant store;
Her whispering airs, and scenes of vernal joy,</br>Her sunny vale, green hill, and babbling brook.</br>Thee, nor brown Summer woos,</br>Fond stripling of desire,
Who, breathless, pants across the sultry wilds,</br>Or, seeks the crystal depth, or rustling shade,</br>Where, thro' his glowing sense</br>A cool refreshment breathes.
Unblest by thee, dejected Autumn dies;</br>When fading Nature warns us of decay,</br>And, leafless forests howl,</br>Hoarse winds, and storms pursue
The boisterous track of Winter!  Driving hail</br>From dun bleak skies, quick-pattering on the cliffs</br>Descends; while hamlets groan</br>Beneath collected snows.
Then, torrents wild, with deafening clamours, roar,</br>And fearful nights succeed tempestuous days,</br>And Fancy blacker paints</br>Thy frantic, dark despair.
By thee deprest, poor unprotected Worth</br>Shrinks into blind obscurity's damp cell;</br>There, lingering, and forgot,</br>He meets a silent grave.
Deprest by thee, how groans the shipwreck'd wretch,</br>Cast on loose-hanging, frightful rocks, forlorn,</br>While round him dreadful breaks</br>The foamy billow's rage!
Ah!  grim-brow'd tyrant, mitigate thy wrath,</br>Forbear to blast me with thy withering gaze;</br>With deadly-pressing hand</br>Forbear to chill my heart!</br>
